1.text: I made a covenant with mine eyes; How then should I look upon a maid?

2.text: For what would be the portion of God from above, And the heritage of the Almighty from on high?

3.text: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, And disaster to the workers of iniquity?

4.text: Doth not He see my ways, And count all my steps?

5.text: If I have walked with vanity, And my foot hath hasted to deceit—

6.text: Let me be weighed in a just balance, That God may know mine integrity—

7.text: If my step hath turned out of the way, And my heart walked after mine eyes, And if any spot hath cleaved to my hands;

8.text: Then let me sow, and let another eat; Yea, let the produce of my field be rooted out.

9.text: If my heart have been enticed unto a woman, And I have lain in wait at my neighbour’s door;

10.text: Then let my wife grind unto another, And let others bow down upon her.

11.text: For that were a heinous crime; Yea, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

12.text: For it is a fire that consumeth unto destruction, And would root out all mine increase.

13.text: If I did despise the cause of my man-servant, Or of my maid-servant, when they contended with me—

14.text: What then shall I do when God riseth up? And when He remembereth, what shall I answer Him?

15.text: Did not He that made me in the womb make him? And did not One fashion us in the womb?

16.text: If I have withheld aught that the poor desired, Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

17.text: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof—

18.text: Nay, from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, And I have been her guide from my mother’s womb.

19.text: If I have seen any wanderer in want of clothing, Or that the needy had no covering;

20.text: If his loins have not blessed me, And if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

21.text: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, Because I saw my help in the gate;

22.text: Then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder-blade, And mine arm be broken from the bone.

23.text: For calamity from God was a terror to me, And by reason of His majesty I could do nothing.

24.text: If I have made gold my hope, And have said to the fine gold: ‘Thou art my confidence’;

25.text: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gotten much;

26.text: If I beheld the sun when it shined, Or the moon walking in brightness;

27.text: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, And my mouth hath kissed my hand;

28.text: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judges; For I should have lied to God that is above.

29.text: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, Or exulted when evil found him—

30.text: Yea, I suffered not my mouth to sin By asking his life with a curse.

31.text: If the men of my tent said not: ‘Who can find one that hath not been satisfied with his meat?’

32.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street; My doors I opened to the roadside.

33.text: If after the manner of men I covered my transgressions, By hiding mine iniquity in my bosom—

34.text: Because I feared the great multitude, And the most contemptible among families terrified me, So that I kept silence, and went not out of the door.

35.text: Oh that I had one to hear me!—Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me—And that I had the indictment which mine adversary hath written!

36.text: Surely I would carry it upon my shoulder; I would bind it unto me as a crown.

37.text: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; As a prince would I go near unto him.

38.text: If my land cry out against me, And the furrows thereof weep together;

39.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, Or have caused the tillers thereof to be disappointed—

40.text: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, And noisome weeds instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
